name: Allay
oracle_text: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Destroy target enchantment.

name: Angelic Blessing
oracle_text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.

name: Cataclysm
oracle_text: Each player chooses from among the permanents they control an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, then sacrifices the rest.
flavor_text: The Weatherlight dragged the Predator behind it, the cradle hauling the casket.

rulings.text: If you control a permanent with more than one type, you can choose that same permanent for more than one of the choices if you want to. This makes it possible to select an artifact creature as both your artifact and creature, and then select a land and thereby keep only two cards.

If you control a permanent with more than one type, you can choose that permanent to be the representative of either type. This makes it possible to have more than one creature (or other permanent type) on the battlefield. For example, if you select a creature for your creature and an artifact creature for your artifact, you get to keep both of these creatures.
The permanents to save are chosen on resolution. You do not choose them when casting the spell.
The current player makes their choices before the other player. After both players make choices, all the sacrifices are done simultaneously.
Each permanent not chosen by a player will be sacrificed. If a permanent has none of the listed types (for example, a Planeswalker with no other types), it can’t be chosen.

name: Charging Paladin
oracle_text: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
flavor_text: "Hope shall be the blade that severs our bonds."

name: Convalescence
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 10 or less life, you gain 1 life.
flavor_text: Selenia had hurt Mirri terribly, but injuries of the flesh could be treated. The wounds she had torn in Crovax's soul would never close.

rulings.text: The life total is checked when it triggers and the ability will be put on the stack only if you have 10 life or less. It checks again on resolution and does nothing if you have more life by then.

name: Exalted Dragon
oracle_text: Flying
Exalted Dragon can't attack unless you sacrifice a land. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)
flavor_text: If dragons excel at anything more than vanity, it is greed.

rulings.text: You have to sacrifice a land at the time you declare this creature as an attacker if you want it to attack. This is additive with any other attack costs.

name: High Ground
oracle_text: Each creature you control can block an additional creature each combat.
flavor_text: In war, as in society, position is everything.

rulings.text: High Ground’s effect is cumulative. If you have a creature that can already block an additional creature, now it can block three creatures.

High Ground allows you to make some complicated blocks. For example, if you’re being attacked by three creatures (call them A, B, and C) and you control three creatures (X, Y, and Z), you can have X block A and B, Y block B and C, and Z block just C, among many other possible options. The defending player chooses how each blocking creature’s combat damage will be divided among the creatures it’s blocking.

name: Keeper of the Light
oracle_text: {W}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had more life than you did as you activated this ability. You gain 3 life.

rulings.text: A different opposing player may be targeted each time the ability is activated.
It is only necessary that the condition be true as you activate the ability. The ability will still resolve normally even if the condition is no longer true at that time.

name: Kor Chant
oracle_text: All damage that would be dealt this turn to target creature you control by a source of your choice is dealt to another target creature instead.
flavor_text: The true treasure no thief can touch.

name: Limited Resources
oracle_text: When Limited Resources enters the battlefield, each player chooses five lands they control and sacrifices the rest.
Players can't play lands as long as ten or more lands are on the battlefield.

rulings.text: The sacrificed lands are chosen during resolution. The current player chooses first.
If a player has less than 5 lands, they get to pick and keep all of their lands.
You can put lands onto the battlefield using effects, you just can’t play lands from your hand as an action.

name: Oath of Lieges
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player who controls more lands than they do and is their opponent. The first player may search their library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle their library.

rulings.text: The land card enters the battlefield under the current player’s control.
Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.
Shuffling the library is part of the optional effect. The player only shuffles if they chose to search.
The ability can only target an opponent of the current player.

The targeted player controlling more lands than the current player is a part of the targeting requirement. A player can’t be targeted by this ability unless it’s true, and the ability doesn’t resolve if it’s no longer true at that time.

name: Paladin en-Vec
oracle_text: First strike, protection from black and from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)
flavor_text: "Our belief shall be the lance that pierces Volrath's heart."

name: Peace of Mind
oracle_text: {W}, Discard a card: You gain 3 life.
flavor_text:
Three are the paths of the soul:
One out—roam across the plain,
One back—dwell with tribe and tent,
One in—turn an enemy's hate.

name: Pegasus Stampede
oracle_text: Buyback—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Create a 1/1 white Pegasus creature token with flying.

name: Penance
oracle_text: Put a card from your hand on top of your library: The next time a black or red source of your choice would deal damage this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Reaping the Rewards
oracle_text: Buyback—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
You gain 2 life.

name: Reconnaissance
oracle_text: {0}: Remove target attacking creature you control from combat and untap it.
flavor_text: War favors the informed.

rulings.text: Does not undo any effects which triggered on declaration of attackers or blockers.

name: Shackles
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{W}: Return Shackles to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: Shackles of gold are still shackles.

rulings.text: Shackles does not tap the creature when it enters the battlefield.

name: Shield Mate
oracle_text: Sacrifice Shield Mate: Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.
flavor_text: They bear weightier burdens than the shields they carry.

name: Soltari Visionary
oracle_text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Soltari Visionary deals damage to a player, destroy target enchantment that player controls.

rulings.text: If the damaged player controls any enchantments, you must choose one to be destroyed. If they do not, nothing happens.

name: Soul Warden
oracle_text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
flavor_text:
Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
—Vec teaching

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering the battlefield, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
Two Soul Wardens entering the battlefield at the same time will each cause the other’s ability to trigger.
The life gain is mandatory.

name: Standing Troops
oracle_text: Vigilance
flavor_text: The less you have, the harder you fight for it.

name: Treasure Hunter
oracle_text: When Treasure Hunter enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text:
"What separates junk from treasure is imagination."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Wall of Nets
oracle_text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
At end of combat, exile all creatures blocked by Wall of Nets.
When Wall of Nets leaves the battlefield, return all cards exiled with Wall of Nets to the battlefield under their owners' control.

rulings.text: It only exiles creatures if this card is still on the battlefield at the end of combat.

name: Welkin Hawk
oracle_text: Flying
When Welkin Hawk dies, you may search your library for a card named Welkin Hawk, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You do not have to find a Welkin Hawk card if you do not want to.

name: Zealots en-Dal
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if all nonland permanents you control are white, you gain 1 life.
flavor_text:
"Great chains shall free our warriors."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Aether Tide
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X creature cards.
Return X target creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor_text: The tide of magic brought them here. Now it would take them home.

name: Cunning
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature attacks or blocks, sacrifice Cunning at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
flavor_text:
". . . Dry-walkers die
We feed on sweet flesh . . . ."
—Rootwater Saga

name: Curiosity
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
flavor_text: All Mirri wanted to do was rest, but she couldn't ignore a nagging suspicion as she followed Crovax's skulking form.

rulings.text: “You” refers to the controller of Curiosity, which may be different from the controller of the enchanted creature. “An opponent” refers to an opponent of Curiosity’s controller.
Any damage dealt by the enchanted creature to an opponent will cause Curiosity to trigger, not just combat damage.
Curiosity doesn’t trigger if the enchanted creature deals damage to a planeswalker controlled by an opponent.
You draw one card each time the enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, no matter how much damage it deals or whether it was dealt in combat.
If this Aura enchants an opponent’s creature, you won’t draw a card when that creature damages you. The creature has to deal damage to one of your opponents for the ability to trigger.

name: Dominating Licid
oracle_text: {1}{U}{U}, {T}: Dominating Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {U} to end this effect.
You control enchanted creature.

rulings.text: It becomes an Enchantment - Aura and stops being all other permanent types.
Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can’t be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid’s controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.

name: Ephemeron
oracle_text: Flying
Discard a card: Return Ephemeron to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: From nothing came teeth.

name: Equilibrium
oracle_text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: In Rath, there are only so many souls to go around.

rulings.text: A “creature spell” is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.
The ability is put on the stack immediately after you cast a creature spell, which means the creature that spell will become won’t be a legal target.
The ability will still resolve even if the spell that triggered it gets countered.

name: Ertai, Wizard Adept
oracle_text: {2}{U}{U}, {T}: Counter target spell.
flavor_text:
"Was that it?"
—Ertai, wizard adept

rulings.text: The Legend rule only applies to two legendary permanents with identical names. If the names are different, even if they depict the same character, the rule does not apply.

name: Fade Away
oracle_text: For each creature, its controller sacrifices a permanent unless they pay {1}.
flavor_text:
"Consider the fable of the greedy herder. As her flock grew, so did her weariness; she slept, and the sheep wandered off."
—Karn, silver golem

rulings.text: At the beginning of the resolution, each player counts up the number of creatures they control, then they make the required number of payments and/or sacrifices. The active player announces their choices first followed by the other players, but all the sacrifices are done at the same time. Because of this, you can’t sacrifice one creature in order to pay for another and thereby avoid payment for the first.
You can choose to pay some mana and sacrifice some permanents if you have more than one creature.
You can activate mana abilities during the resolution if you decide to pay mana.

name: Forbid
oracle_text: Buyback—Discard two cards. (You may discard two cards in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Counter target spell.

name: Keeper of the Mind
oracle_text: {U}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had at least two more cards in hand than you did as you activated this ability. Draw a card.

rulings.text: A different opposing player may be targeted each time the ability is activated.
It is only necessary that the condition be true as you activate the ability. The ability will still resolve normally even if the condition is no longer true at that time.

name: Killer Whale
oracle_text: {U}: Killer Whale gains flying until end of turn.
flavor_text: Hunger is like the sea: deep, endless, and unforgiving.

name: Mana Breach
oracle_text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player returns a land they control to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: The wizard had it all—until she tried to use it.

rulings.text: The ability itself is controlled by Mana Breach’s controller.
The person who cast the spell chooses which of their lands is affected.

name: Merfolk Looter
oracle_text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor_text: In the depths of Rootwater, salvage and sewage differ only in texture.

rulings.text: You can’t do anything in between drawing a card and discarding a card, including casting or cycling the card you drew.

name: Mind Over Matter
oracle_text: Discard a card: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
flavor_text:
Lyna turned to the figure beside her. "They're gone. What now?"
"As ever," said Urza, "we wait."

name: Mirozel
oracle_text: Flying
When Mirozel becomes the target of a spell or ability, return Mirozel to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: The mirozels are the only stars in Rath's opaque skies.

rulings.text: Triggers on a spell or ability being changed to target this card.
Triggers on any spell or ability being announced which targets this card. This means it returns to owner’s hand before that spell resolves.

name: Oath of Scholars
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player who has more cards in hand than they do and is their opponent. The first player may discard their hand and draw three cards.

rulings.text: The ability can only target an opponent of the current player.

The targeted player having more cards in their hand than the current player is a part of the targeting requirement. A player can’t be targeted by this ability unless it’s true, and the ability doesn’t resolve if it’s no longer true at that time.

name: Robe of Mirrors
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor_text: "Does this make me look fat?"

rulings.text: Having shroud will prevent the creature from being targeted by Aura spells, but it does not remove any Auras that are already attached to the creature or stop Auras from being moved to the creature by some other method.

name: Rootwater Mystic
oracle_text: {1}{U}: Look at the top card of target player's library.
flavor_text:
"Read the roots    tell the tale
Future forms    in waving weeds
Higher than truth   is hope."
—Rootwater Saga

name: School of Piranha
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice School of Piranha unless you pay {1}{U}.
flavor_text: Some schools aren't worth getting into.

name: Scrivener
oracle_text: When Scrivener enters the battlefield, you may return target instant card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text:
"History is a potent weapon."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Thalakos Drifters
oracle_text: Discard a card: Thalakos Drifters gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor_text: They drift in and out of shadow and ever on toward madness.

rulings.text: The reminder text is only accurate when this card has Shadow.

name: Thalakos Scout
oracle_text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Discard a card: Return Thalakos Scout to its owner's hand.

name: Theft of Dreams
oracle_text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
flavor_text:
"Volrath stole everything there was of me."
—Takara

name: Treasure Trove
oracle_text: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.
flavor_text: Karn and Hanna stood over the recovered Legacy artifacts like loving parents over sleeping children.

name: Wayward Soul
oracle_text: Flying
{U}: Put Wayward Soul on top of its owner's library.
flavor_text:
"no home    no heart    no hope"
—Stronghold graffito

name: Whiptongue Frog
oracle_text: {U}: Whiptongue Frog gains flying until end of turn.
flavor_text: Their favorite food? Wind dancers.

name: Carnophage
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Carnophage unless you pay 1 life.
flavor_text: Eating is all it knows.

name: Cat Burglar
oracle_text: {2}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
flavor_text: The il-Kor no longer roam the open plains, but they are still hunters.

name: Culling the Weak
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Add {B}{B}{B}{B}.
flavor_text:
"The blood of the weak shall be the ink with which we scribe great Yawgmoth's glorious name."
—Stronghold architect, journal

rulings.text: You sacrifice a creature when casting the spell and you can’t sacrifice more than one creature to get extra mana.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

name: Cursed Flesh
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor_text: A farewell to arms . . . and feet . . . and legs . . . .

name: Dauthi Cutthroat
oracle_text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{1}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with shadow.
flavor_text: In their twisted logic, to empty the shadow world is to escape it.

name: Dauthi Jackal
oracle_text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{B}{B}, Sacrifice Dauthi Jackal: Destroy target blocking creature.
flavor_text:
"All Dauthi are jackals, regardless of breed."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

rulings.text: This creature does not have to be an attacker or blocker to use its ability.

name: Dauthi Warlord
oracle_text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Dauthi Warlord's power is equal to the number of creatures with shadow on the battlefield.

rulings.text: Dauthi Warlord counts creatures with the Shadow ability controlled by all players.

name: Death's Duet
oracle_text: Return two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: Life has always been a dance. It is only fitting that death sing the tune.

name: Entropic Specter
oracle_text: Flying
As Entropic Specter enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Entropic Specter's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in the chosen player's hand.
Whenever Entropic Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.

rulings.text: The opponent does not discard a card if all the damage is prevented.

You choose one opposing player during resolution and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if this card changes controllers. It becomes 0/0 if the chosen player leaves the game.

name: Fugue
oracle_text: Target player discards three cards.
flavor_text: "My ship . . . ," Sisay mumbled. "Intact," Gerrard reassured her, "which is more than I can say for you, my friend." Sisay laughed despite the pain.

name: Grollub
oracle_text: Whenever Grollub is dealt damage, each opponent gains that much life.
flavor_text: Mogglings caught in a misdeed often blame the grollub. Even though the creature is usually innocent, no taskmaster can resist an excuse to beat it.

name: Hatred
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay X life.
Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"I will flay the skin from your flesh and the flesh from your bones and scrape your bones dry. And still you will not have suffered enough."
—Greven il-Vec, to Gerrard

rulings.text: The life payment is part of the cost to cast Hatred, so it is lost if this spell is countered.

name: Keeper of the Dead
oracle_text: {B}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had at least two fewer creature cards in their graveyard than you did as you activated this ability. Destroy target nonblack creature that player controls.

rulings.text: A different opposing player may be targeted each time the ability is activated.
It is only necessary that the condition be true as you activate the ability. The ability will still resolve normally even if the condition is no longer true at that time.

name: Mind Maggots
oracle_text: When Mind Maggots enters the battlefield, discard any number of creature cards. For each card discarded this way, put two +1/+1 counters on Mind Maggots.

rulings.text: You can choose to discard zero creature cards.

name: Nausea
oracle_text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Any mogg will tell you there's nothing more nauseating than the smell of cute.

rulings.text: All creatures on the battlefield when Nausea resolves are affected. Ones that enter the battlefield or become creatures later in the turn are not.

name: Necrologia
oracle_text: Cast this spell only during your end step.
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay X life.
Draw X cards.
flavor_text:
"My enemies' death yields threefold benefit: removal, reuse, and research."
—Volrath

rulings.text: This spell is cast during the End step. Since you discard down to 7 cards in the cleanup step, this card is used before the discard.

name: Oath of Ghouls
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player whose graveyard has fewer creature cards in it than their graveyard does and is their opponent. The first player may return a creature card from their graveyard to their hand.

rulings.text: The ability can only target an opponent of the current player.

The targeted player’s graveyard having fewer creature cards in it than the current player’s is a part of the targeting requirement. A player can’t be targeted by this ability unless it’s true, and the ability doesn’t resolve if it’s no longer true at that time.

name: Pit Spawn
oracle_text: First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Pit Spawn unless you pay {B}{B}.
Whenever Pit Spawn deals damage to a creature, exile that creature.

rulings.text: Since this card has First Strike it will often deal damage during first strike damage dealing and its ability will exile the creature it damages before that creature can deal damage back.

name: Plaguebearer
oracle_text: {X}{X}{B}: Destroy target nonblack creature with converted mana cost X.
flavor_text: Its respiration is your expiration.

name: Recurring Nightmare
oracle_text: Sacrifice a creature, Return Recurring Nightmare to its owner's hand: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
flavor_text:
"I am confined by sleep and defined by nightmare."
—Crovax

rulings.text: If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you’ll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

name: Scare Tactics
oracle_text: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"Fear rules those weak enough to accept it."
—Greven il-Vec

name: Slaughter
oracle_text: Buyback—Pay 4 life. (You may pay 4 life in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: You can’t pay the buyback if you have less than 4 life, even if an effect would keep you from losing for having 0 or less life.

name: Spike Cannibal
oracle_text: Spike Cannibal enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
When Spike Cannibal enters the battlefield, move all +1/+1 counters from all creatures onto it.

name: Thrull Surgeon
oracle_text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice Thrull Surgeon: Look at target player's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
flavor_text: "Just take a little off the top."

name: Vampire Hounds
oracle_text: Discard a creature card: Vampire Hounds gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor_text: The hounds' barks are a horrifying chorus of screams, moans, and whispers.

name: Volrath's Dungeon
oracle_text: Pay 5 life: Destroy Volrath's Dungeon. Any player may activate this ability but only during their turn.
Discard a card: Target player puts a card from their hand on top of their library. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Anarchist
oracle_text: When Anarchist enters the battlefield, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: "I'll take that. You won't need it when the revolution comes."

name: Cinder Crawler
oracle_text: {R}: Cinder Crawler gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if Cinder Crawler is blocked.
flavor_text: The crawler doesn't care what gets in its way. It pushes everything into the boiling muck and waits for the meal to cook.

name: Dizzying Gaze
oracle_text: Enchant creature you control
{R}: Enchanted creature deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
flavor_text:
"When I cut down my angel I only started my fall."
—Crovax

rulings.text: Dizzying Gaze can’t be cast targeting an opponent’s creature. And this card is put into the graveyard if ever on a creature you do not control.

name: Fighting Chance
oracle_text: For each blocking creature, flip a coin. If you win the flip, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by that creature this turn.
flavor_text: A stroke of luck can smite an army.

name: Flowstone Flood
oracle_text: Buyback—Pay 3 life, Discard a card at random. (You may pay 3 life and discard a card at random in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Destroy target land.

rulings.text: You can’t pay the Buyback cost unless you have at least one card in your hand to discard.

name: Furnace Brood
oracle_text: {R}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.
flavor_text: Furnace air crackles with magmatic cackles.

name: Keeper of the Flame
oracle_text: {R}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had more life than you did as you activated this ability. Keeper of the Flame deals 2 damage to that player.

rulings.text: A different opposing player may be targeted each time the ability is activated.
It is only necessary that the condition be true as you activate the ability. The ability will still resolve normally even if the condition is no longer true at that time.

name: Mage il-Vec
oracle_text: {T}, Discard a card at random: Mage il-Vec deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor_text: Living below a flowstone foundry produces a disproportionate number of fire mages among the il.

rulings.text: You must discard a card as part of the activation cost. You can’t announce the ability unless you have a card in hand.

name: Maniacal Rage
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.
flavor_text: Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.

name: Mogg Assassin
oracle_text: {T}: You choose target creature an opponent controls, and that opponent chooses target creature. Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy the creature you chose. If you lose the flip, destroy the creature your opponent chose.

rulings.text: You and your opponent both pick the target creatures on announcing, which is before the coin is flipped. You pick first.

name: Monstrous Hound
oracle_text: Monstrous Hound can't attack unless you control more lands than defending player.
Monstrous Hound can't block unless you control more lands than attacking player.
flavor_text: "Stay."

name: Oath of Mages
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player who has more life than they do and is their opponent. The first player may have Oath of Mages deal 1 damage to the second player.

rulings.text: The ability can only target an opponent of the current player.

The targeted player having more life than the current player is a part of the targeting requirement. A player can’t be targeted by this ability unless it’s true, and the ability doesn’t resolve if it’s no longer true at that time.

name: Ogre Shaman
oracle_text: {2}, Discard a card at random: Ogre Shaman deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor_text: Ogre shamans must be bright enough to learn their invocations and dim enough to use them.

name: Onslaught
oracle_text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, tap target creature.
flavor_text: The last thing to go through the mogg's mind was its teeth.

rulings.text: Can target an already tapped creature.
The ability is not optional. If you have the only targetable creatures, you have to tap one of your own.
A “creature spell” is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

name: Pandemonium
oracle_text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, that creature's controller may have it deal damage equal to its power to any target of their choice.
flavor_text:
"If we cannot live proudly, we die so!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

rulings.text: The triggered ability does not check the creature’s power until the ability resolves. If the creature is not on the battlefield when the ability resolves, it does damage equal to the power of the creature right before it left the battlefield. This means that if a creature enters the battlefield which can destroy itself as a “enters the battlefield” ability, the order of resolution of the triggered abilities does not matter.

If player A controls Pandemonium when a creature enters the battlefield under player B’s control, player A controls the triggered ability even though player B chooses the target and chooses whether to have the creature deal damage, which could be important if multiple abilities controlled by multiple players trigger.

name: Paroxysm
oracle_text: Enchant creature

At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player reveals the top card of their library. If that card is a land card, destroy that creature. Otherwise, it gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

rulings.text: The ability is not optional.

name: Price of Progress
oracle_text: Price of Progress deals damage to each player equal to twice the number of nonbasic lands that player controls.
flavor_text: Man versus nature is not a fair fight.

name: Raging Goblin
oracle_text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor_text: Volrath has bred them to fear only him. Are they charging into battle, or merely fleeing his wrath?

name: Ravenous Baboons
oracle_text: When Ravenous Baboons enters the battlefield, destroy target nonbasic land.
flavor_text: Build something and the baboons will tear it down. Leave the pieces lying and they will scatter them.

rulings.text: If there is no non-basic land to destroy, the ability does nothing.
You have to pick one of your own non-basic lands if the opponent does not have any and you do.

name: Reckless Ogre
oracle_text: Whenever Reckless Ogre attacks alone, it gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: There is no such thing as a regiment of ogres.

name: Sabertooth Wyvern
oracle_text: Flying, first strike
flavor_text: Most creatures grow out of their baby teeth, but sabertooth wyverns grow into theirs.

name: Scalding Salamander
oracle_text: Whenever Scalding Salamander attacks, you may have it deal 1 damage to each creature without flying defending player controls.

rulings.text: The ability triggers on the declaration of attackers and will resolve before blockers are declared.

name: Seismic Assault
oracle_text: Discard a land card: Seismic Assault deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor_text: The flowstone seemed for a moment to assume Greven's rage—it lunged like a wild beast at the Weatherlight.

rulings.text: If an effect instructs you to draw cards and then discard cards, you can’t take actions in between. For example, if you have no cards in hand and cast Faithless Looting, you can’t activate Seismic Assault’s ability between the time you draw two cards and discard those two cards.

name: Shattering Pulse
oracle_text: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Destroy target artifact.

name: Sonic Burst
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card at random.
Sonic Burst deals 4 damage to any target.
flavor_text: Music scythes the savage beast.

rulings.text: You can’t discard more than once to target more than one creature (or player) or to do multiple amounts of damage to a single creature (or player).
You pick the target before you know which card is going to be discarded.

name: Spellshock
oracle_text: Whenever a player casts a spell, Spellshock deals 2 damage to that player.
flavor_text: A snap of fingers, a snap of teeth.

rulings.text: It affects all players, including you.

name: Avenging Druid
oracle_text: Whenever Avenging Druid deals damage to an opponent, you may reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a land card. If you do, put that card onto the battlefield and put all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.

rulings.text: The ability does not work if all damage is prevented.
Putting a land onto the battlefield does not count as playing a land.

name: Bequeathal
oracle_text: Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, you draw two cards.
flavor_text:
"On my death, I give you this treasure: the knowledge that life is hard, yet too soon past."
—Dal funeral rite

name: Cartographer
oracle_text: When Cartographer enters the battlefield, you may return target land card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: How do you map a world when the land moves beneath your feet?

name: Crashing Boars
oracle_text: Whenever Crashing Boars attacks, defending player chooses an untapped creature they control. That creature blocks Crashing Boars this turn if able.
flavor_text: Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.

rulings.text: If the chosen creature is not still untapped at the time blockers are declared, it does not have to block.
The ability is not optional. If there are no untapped creatures to choose, then the ability does nothing.

name: Elven Palisade
oracle_text: Sacrifice a Forest: Target attacking creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"Volrath is not the only one who can shape this world to serve him."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Elvish Berserker
oracle_text: Whenever Elvish Berserker becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
flavor_text: Their fury scatters enemies like a pile of dry leaves.

name: Jackalope Herd
oracle_text: When you cast a spell, return Jackalope Herd to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: There's little more demeaning than getting your butt kicked by a bunch of bunnies.

rulings.text: It will only return if it is still on the battlefield when the triggered ability resolves.

name: Keeper of the Beasts
oracle_text: {G}, {T}: Choose target opponent who controlled more creatures than you did as you activated this ability. Create a 2/2 green Beast creature token.

rulings.text: A different opposing player may be targeted each time the ability is activated.
It is only necessary that the condition be true as you activate the ability. The ability will still resolve normally even if the condition is no longer true at that time.

name: Manabond
oracle_text: At the beginning of your end step, you may reveal your hand and put all land cards from it onto the battlefield. If you do, discard your hand.

rulings.text: The lands are put onto the battlefield during the resolution of the ability.
You discard all the cards still in your hand after you put the lands onto the battlefield.
Putting a land onto the battlefield does not count as playing a land.

name: Mirri, Cat Warrior
oracle_text: First strike, forestwalk, vigilance (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike, it can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

name: Oath of Druids
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player who controls more creatures than they do and is their opponent. The first player may reveal cards from the top of their library until they reveal a creature card. If the first player does, that player puts that card onto the battlefield and all other cards revealed this way into their graveyard.

rulings.text: The ability can only target an opponent of the current player.

The targeted player controlling more creatures than the current player is a part of the targeting requirement. A player can’t be targeted by this ability unless it’s true, and the ability doesn’t resolve if it’s no longer true at that time.

name: Plated Rootwalla
oracle_text: {2}{G}: Plated Rootwalla gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
flavor_text:
" . . . And the third little boar built his house out of rootwalla plates . . . ."
—Skyshroud children's story

rulings.text: If this card’s ability is activated by one player, then another player takes control of it on the same turn, the second player can’t activate its ability that turn.

name: Predatory Hunger
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
flavor_text: Hunger growls, never purrs.

rulings.text: A “creature spell” is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

name: Pygmy Troll
oracle_text: Whenever Pygmy Troll becomes blocked by a creature, Pygmy Troll gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{G}: Regenerate Pygmy Troll.
flavor_text: "Who you callin' ‘shorty'?"

name: Rabid Wolverines
oracle_text: Whenever Rabid Wolverines becomes blocked by a creature, Rabid Wolverines gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Is there any other kind?

name: Reclaim
oracle_text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
flavor_text: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.

name: Resuscitate
oracle_text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain "{1}: Regenerate this creature."
flavor_text:
"It is the art of convincing someone to live."
—Orim, Samite healer

rulings.text: Only grants the ability to creatures you control when this spell resolves. Ones entering the battlefield later in the turn do not get it.

name: Rootwater Alligator
oracle_text: Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate Rootwater Alligator.
flavor_text: Subduing and skinning an alligator is the first rite of maturity adolescent merfolk must pass.

name: Skyshroud Elite
oracle_text: Skyshroud Elite gets +1/+2 as long as an opponent controls a nonbasic land.
flavor_text:
"Civilization is a conspiracy to disguise the mutilation of nature."
—Skyshroud elite creed

name: Skyshroud War Beast
oracle_text: Trample
As Skyshroud War Beast enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Skyshroud War Beast's power and toughness are each equal to the number of nonbasic lands the chosen player controls.

rulings.text: The power and toughness are continuously recalculated.

name: Song of Serenity
oracle_text: Creatures that are enchanted can't attack or block.
flavor_text: Heartwood brings peace in great symphonies where dryads conduct the trees through every note.

name: Spike Hatcher
oracle_text: Spike Hatcher enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Hatcher: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Hatcher: Regenerate Spike Hatcher.

name: Spike Rogue
oracle_text: Spike Rogue enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Rogue: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from a creature you control: Put a +1/+1 counter on Spike Rogue.

name: Spike Weaver
oracle_text: Spike Weaver enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Weaver: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Weaver: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

rulings.text: The second ability includes your own creatures as well.

name: Survival of the Fittest
oracle_text: {G}, Discard a creature card: Search your library for a creature card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

name: Wood Elves
oracle_text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
flavor_text: Secure in the embrace of wood, they want no part of Eladamri's war.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

name: Coat of Arms
oracle_text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
flavor_text:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."
—Mogg march

rulings.text: If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
Sharing multiple creature types doesn’t give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

name: Erratic Portal
oracle_text: {1}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.
flavor_text: "In Barrin's name!" cried Lyna as Hanna's sword passed through her, "Ertai sends word that the portal is open-but not for long!"

name: Medicine Bag
oracle_text: {1}, {T}, Discard a card: Regenerate target creature.
flavor_text:
"My medicine bag and I have treated countless wounds and illnesses. But never have I seen so many made so sick for so long. We will never eat Squee's cooking again."
—Orim, journal

name: Memory Crystal
oracle_text: Buyback costs cost {2} less.
flavor_text: Hues of recollection flicker like facets of a gem.

rulings.text: Can’t reduce the cost below zero.
Does not apply to other parts of the cost.
Only affects generic mana portions of Buyback costs.
It applies to all players.
The ability is not optional.

name: Mindless Automaton
oracle_text: Mindless Automaton enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mindless Automaton.
Remove two +1/+1 counters from Mindless Automaton: Draw a card.

name: Null Brooch
oracle_text: {2}, {T}, Discard your hand: Counter target noncreature spell.
flavor_text:
Give away everything so others have nothing.
—Brooch inscription

rulings.text: A “creature spell” is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

name: Skyshaper
oracle_text: Sacrifice Skyshaper: Creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"It'll get us to the portal, but I can't guarantee what it'll do to the ship."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Spellbook
oracle_text: You have no maximum hand size.
flavor_text:
"Everything the wise woman learned she wrote in a book, and when the pages were black with ink, she took white ink and began again."
—Karn, silver golem

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Spellbook onto the battlefield, you’ll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

name: Sphere of Resistance
oracle_text: Spells cost {1} more to cast.
flavor_text: A sphere pushes equally in all directions.

rulings.text: It affects all players, including you.

name: Thopter Squadron
oracle_text: Flying
Thopter Squadron enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Thopter Squadron: Create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
{1}, Sacrifice another Thopter: Put a +1/+1 counter on Thopter Squadron. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Transmogrifying Licid
oracle_text: {1}, {T}: Transmogrifying Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {1} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and is an artifact in addition to its other types.

rulings.text: If the permanent it is on was only a creature due to an effect, when that effect ends, the Licid will find itself enchanting something illegal and be put into the graveyard.
The enchanted creature gains the artifact type in addition to any other card types it may already have.
Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can’t be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid’s controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.

When the activated ability resolves, Transmogrifying Licid becomes an Aura enchantment and ceases to be either a creature or an artifact. Since it is no longer a creature, it also loses the creature type Licid. When the effect is ended, it goes back to being an artifact creature with the creature type Licid and ceases to be an Aura enchantment.

name: Workhorse
oracle_text: Workhorse enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Workhorse: Add {C}.

name: City of Traitors
oracle_text: When you play another land, sacrifice City of Traitors.
{T}: Add {C}{C}.
flavor_text:
"While we fought, the il surrendered."
—Oracle en-Vec

rulings.text: City of Traitors does not trigger on lands that are put onto the battlefield without playing them.
City of Traitors does not trigger on itself being played.
